title: Pakistan look to fix batting woes against Sri Lanka in second T20I
text:
The invincible T20I side, Pakistan will look to find their lost magic in the second T20 International of the three-match series against Sri Lanka at the Gaddafi Stadium on Monday October 7.

On Saturday, the new-look Sri Lanka achieved their biggest T20 win over green shirts by the highest run-margin (64 runs) so far in T20Is on the back of some remarkable batting and bowling in Lahore.

While chasing 165, Pakistan’s batting collapsed completely as Ahmed Shehzad and Umar Akmal once again failed to create an impact in their comeback games for Pakistan in the format.

Babar Azam, Sarfraz Ahmed, and Iftikhar were the only three batsmen who managed to get into the double figures.

Ahead of the first match, the skipper Sarfraz Ahmed was hopeful that the selected squad for the series will easily defeat the opposition but failed to do so as their batting line tumbled on 101 in the 18th over.

Pakistan will need a strong performance from their experienced top four against the in-form Sri Lankan side, to stage a comeback and set up the final game as a series decider on Wednesday, 9 October.

However, the visitors will look to carry the same intensity going forward to seal the series in the second game.
